dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: ...Journalism.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: And smart! So it’s like, you’re hot, you’re smart, obviously you're driven, I don’t know, I could be wrong, but I think you won’t have a hard time having a cool life.

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: Wow, you really think so?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Totally! I-

dialogues.speaker: ALLISON
dialogues.text: I DON’T CARE ABOUT WHAT YOU'RE SAYING, YOU IDIOT. She rushes towards him with the shard and-  75. Cole closes his eyes and- BAM. Allison SLAMS into SHE’S BEEN SHOT IN Her body slumps to Staring at BEE. Bee tosses the gun the kitchen cabinets violently as- THE HEAD. the floor, as Cole slowly looks up- on the table and sighs.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: She was so annoying. She never ever did anything to help. She probably has a secret tumblr all about it. You know what it is? She was the kinda girl that still listens to Smashing Pumpkins. She smirks at Cole.

dialogues.speaker: BEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So tonight, huh. Cole leans his head back against the cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I want to throw up.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: You and me both. Now I have to move and shit. Do the whole “new girl at high school” for the hundredth time. You've really done a number on us.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Well. You shot her.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Her boob was ruined. She wanted to die. Sonya?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Crawlspace.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Max?

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Woods. Samuel's body?  76.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Ditched it with the cop car.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: When?!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: It’s like, 5am bro. We’ve been doing this dance of ours for about six hours. Cole can’t believe this. He looks at the clock and what s says is somehow true.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Holy crap. I thought it was all continuous and in real time.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: That’s just the adrenaline. An awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: So...

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Yeah. So. This is the part I’m not really excited about.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Are you gonna shoot me?

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: No! I was only shooting around you because I was hoping you’d just put your hands up and shit. She sighs. BEE (CONT’D) Plus I’m out of bullets.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Hooray.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: But, I mean, two cops are dead. She nods to Allison.  77.

dialogues.speaker: BEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Couple high schoolers. I gotta skip town. And that leaves you, and what to do with you. Any suggestions? Cole is silent. Then-

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What is that thing anyway? Bee looks at the weird stone sculpture- And instantly notices-

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Where is the- She turns back to Cole- To find him holding the book. So old. So weathered. So dry. And in his other hand, he still holds the CANDLE LIGHTER. Its flame ready and hungry. Bee loses her breath. She looks BEE (CONT’D) Cole, listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Cole, listen to me-

dialogues.speaker: NO, BEE
dialogues.text: at him, hands raised, surprised at his outburst.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have been hunted for I guess six hours now! You’ve stolen my blood, killed people, shot at me and just been general assholes all night! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I wanna know what the hell is going on!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Cole. Seriously. You’re too young to understand. Trust me. Cole stares at her blankly for a moment. Before saying:

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Cole!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: No! You deserved that! What, just because I’m twelve means I get to be treated like shit by you, and Jeremy and everyone else? You know what you are? You’re... you’re Don Draper! How he’s all cool and handsome and everyone loves him and then he goes home and you find out he has a wife the whole time! He’s such a piece of shit! How do people even like that show?!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Dude, I am so confused-

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It’s from MAD MEN!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: «+-Did you just spoil MAD MEN for me?!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It’s the first episode! You’1l live!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: That’s so douchey!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Really!?! Bee exhales.  She And She Bee And She 79.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: I guess, fine, in the grand scheme of things tonight, it’s not the douchiest.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What happens when you leave here?

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? takes a step forward- he swings the fire closer to the journal. backs up obediently. BEE (CONT’D) Okay! Okay!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’m not the first kid, am I. watches him. is honest.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: And you'll leave here and just... find another faucet.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: You heard that?

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! Yes! Probably! But I can teach you! stretches her hands out to him. BEE (CONT’D) You're the best, man, and I've been... I’ve been bad, to you. But what I do, and what I believe, it’s powerful shit. It’s holy. I used to feel so scared and so small until this-  80. She points to the sculpture. BEE (CONT’D) And now I’m strong and I’m confident. And when I leave town, what if, okay, what if you came with me. As my apprentice. And I'1l teach you everything I know. I’11l teach you how to read that. I’1l be Lady Exposition and you’1l become so strong. Okay? Yeah? No one could ever hurt you again. There would be nothing left to be afraid of. Isn't that what you want? Plus, dude, we'd have fun. And all for a great cause!

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: So... you have a mission.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: What? Yeah, kinda. He thinks about it. BEE (CONT’D) What do you say, dude.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I guess... He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess I have a mission too. And he SETS THE BOOK ON FIRE. It goes up like a match.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: NooOO! Cole tosses it into the living room- Bee runs for it and- Cole runs out the back door. EXT. COLE’S HOME - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong, powerful and brave as fuck- Cole Johnson runs around his house- Towards the front yard- And when he gets there- He doesn’t go back into his house. He pulls out the keys to Melanie’s Dumb Dad’s Dumb SUV. AND UNLOCKS THAT SHIT. Gets inside. And slams that fucker closed. INT. MELANIE’S DUMB DAD’S DUMB SUV - NIGHT With the head lights off, Cole slowly reverses out of the drive way- Straight back up the street. He does his best to angle the front of the car so it’s directly facing his house. He sees Bee inside. Putting out the blazing book desperately. Cole closes his eyes- Takes a deep breath- And does his best to not let on how fucking terrified he HIS BEST IS MORE THAN GOOD ENOUGH. He opens his eyes: CLEAR EYES. He exhales: FULL HEARTS. He grips the wheel: CAN’T LOSE. He SLAMS his foot on the gas. SCREAMS as the car surges towards the house as-— Bee looks up. Sees the car flying towards her.  82. Sighs. The car SMASHES through the front of the house in a storm glass and rubble. The airbag HITS Cole full on as- Bee goes flying as the SUV tears through the room- Before coming to a stop. Debris falls from the ceiling as- Cole coughs. His whole body hurts. He pushes the airbag away and tries to look out the windo It’s hard to see anything. Gingerly, he opens the door and falls out of the SUV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cole stumbles with unsure footing through the rubble, loo for Bee, until-

dialogues.speaker: BEE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What up, Cee. Cole looks down and sees Bee, covered in rubble. He hesitantly walks over to her as she weakly pushes shit of her. She looks like, well, like she got hit by a car.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: What up, Bee.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: You drove a car into your house. I really didn’t see that coming. She coughs disgustingly. Lays back flat. BEE (CONT’D) I think you broke my ribs.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. It happens.  83. She looks at him. BEE (CONT’D) You never told me your intergalactic dream team.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: You didn’t ask.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: I should have. I’m usually pretty good about that stuff. Cole leans exhausted against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Admiral Adama to lead it. Data for his intelligence and cool head. Predator to fight. (quieter) Then me and you. Bee smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: You didn’t say we could add ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: It’s science fiction. You can do anything.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: I guess that’s true. But don’t you get it yet? He looks down at her. BEE (CONT’D) You bring me on your trip because I'm beautiful, and I listen to you, and I make you think you’re a unique snowflake and an adult and we get to the big bad’s lair, and suddenly you’re confused because no one’s there. “Where is he?” you ask me, turning around to see me smiling at you. Here I am Cole. The big bad that you brought along for the ride and that your parents paid to be your friend. Cole processes this.  84.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I loved you. For a split second, it seems to affect Bee. But then it vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think you do. Sirens can be heard coming in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: COLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t care about your dumb book or your creepy statue or your dead languages. I am an adult. Because when I realized you were the big bad and betrayed me and were just going to hurt other nice kids like Samuel and Melanie, I drove a stolen SUV through you. Bee laughs. Coughs again hard.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: That... that I’1l give you. (then) See ya, Cee. Cole looks at her sadly.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Goodbye. And does not reply as he has millions of times before. The cops pull up to the house and Cole slowly walks outsi EXT. COLE’S HOME - NIGHT It’s a strange sight, an SUV smashed through the front of suburban home, cops and ambulances rushing to the scene- And a twelve year old boy who’s survived a war walking ca outside to greet them. LATER. Cole is sitting on the front yard, facing the destroyed house, an insulation blanket wrapped around his shoulders  85. Melanie’s Dad is losing his unholy shit in the background the cops. Melanie stares at Cole’s house like it’s the most amazing painting she’s ever seen. One by one, stretchers carry out the high-schoolers. Max. Allison. And Sonya. And John the Baptist. A fireman approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: You said there was another young woman in the house too? Cole nods.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We didn’t find anyone, kid-

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: My name is Cole.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Cole. Sorry. Are you sure there was someone else in there? Cole stares straight ahead at the place.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: There was when I drove into it. The fireman doesn’t really know how to react to that as- A car comes flying down the street- COLE’S PARENTS. They park and rush out of the car, astonished at their ho desperate to find Cole.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: Dad goes straight to the cops, who point to his son, sitt alone in the front yard. Mom and Dad approach Cole quickly. Mom grabs Dad’s hand, united in this moment.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son? Cole turns around, like it’s no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: COLE
dialogues.text: I don’t need a sitter anymore. 86. And with that said, he turns back and faces the house he destroyed and the night he defeated. And he fucking smiles. THE END.  And now, the opening scene from THE BABYSITTER 2. 87.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is totally dark. And totally quiet. Totally, that is, except for the soft breathing. As your eyes get used to the darkness, you realize you ar not alone here. A little girl, TAMMY (10), is hiding here. She does her best not to make a peep. She peeks through the closet doors and- Sees THE SHAPE OF SOMEONE searching the room. Wielding a flashlight. Tammy holds her breath. As the person with the flashlight leaves the room. She exhales just a little-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teapot whistles as- MR. AND MRS. MORGAN return home from their night away.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Tammy-baby! We’re-

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MORGAN
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: OH MY GOD
dialogues.text: She runs into the kitchen where- Tammy is unconscious on a kitchen chair- Tied up with a LOT of rope.  89.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Uh-uh-uh. Mrs. Morgan and her husband freeze and- Slowly turn to see someone pouring themselves some tea. VOICE (CONT’D) I’d get you some tea, but I’m actually pretty pissed off with you both. So... She turns around and faces them, revealing, of course:

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: No tea for you. FIVE MINUTES LATER. Bee sits beside the still sleeping Tammy, while Mr. and M Morgan watch in terror. Bee slowly drinks her tea. Puts it back on her plate.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Naw, I’m just fucking with you, I don’t drink tea. They continue staring at her in terror.

dialogues.speaker: BEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just liked the idea of you guys walking home, a kettle going off, your little Regan MacNeil tied to a chair, and me drinking tea calmly.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: ..-Like... Ronald Regan? Bee nonchalantly THROWS THE TEA CUP ACROSS THE ROOM. Where it shatters. Mr. and Mrs. Morgan jump in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: But I am not calm, David and Mallory, am I. They shake their heads as if they were five years old.  BEE (CONT’D) I’m pretty far from calm. I am light years away from calm. Because I am so sick of this shit. She points at them. BEE (CONT’D) You had one job. We agreed to this. In fact, what did I say when I sought you out?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: (whisper) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Excuse me, David?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: You said nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Why did I say nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Be...because we sought you out and asked you to help. Bee sits back in her chair, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Ding ding ding! So you can imagine how super annoying it is when, the kid and I are hanging out, the kid goes to bed, I go to do my thing and- She slams forward- BEE (CONT’D) You didn’t tell her to take the pills I gave you.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MORGAN
dialogues.text: We did tell her!

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Well then you're a terrible parent, because now here you are, here I am, angry, and here is your daughter. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should I wake her up and be like, mommy and daddy signed you up for this so they could have happier lives?

dialogues.speaker: MR. MORGAN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. MORGAN
dialogues.text: Please! Bee turns Tammy’s head so she’s facing her parents.

dialogues.speaker: BEE
dialogues.text: Mommy, why don't you love me enough to not be completely happy just in mothering me? Why did you need to call this attractive, smart, dangerous girl and beg her to help you in ways I never could, because I am a real Regan MacNeil? Mrs. Morgan answers by staring at her lap and crying. Bee sighs. BEE (CONT’D) You'll tell her it was a nightmare. You’1l tell her that she woke up screaming and, me being the concerned lady I am, called you and you rushed home. You’1ll have her write me a cute apology card, and I’ll write her a cute one back. I'll put twenty bucks in it for a movie and popcorn, and you’1l take her to something PG-13 so it’s extra special. When she asks why I don’t babysit her anymore, you'll say I have a boyfriend and am too busy getting laid to babysit. That last part can be open to your own creative license. The rest cannot. Bee stands up. The Morgans stand up. Except for Tammy, because she is tied up and asleep and a real Regan MacNeil.  92. BEE (CONT’D) I think you’1ll agree that our deal is off. No harm no foul, and be thankful for that. They nod, like rebuked five year olds. BEE (CONT’D) Groovy. You can paypal me the money you owe me for babysitting your asswipe of a kid. Bee walks up to them. They flinch. BEE (CONT’D) She actually threw Beverly Cleary books at me. What the shit, guys. Bee stares Mr. and Mrs. Morgan down hard. It’s terrifying. And then she smiles like everything is super! BEE (CONT’D) Ciao! And she walks chipper out of the house. When she closes the door, Mrs. Morgan breaks out into a s Mr. Morgan looks to the heavens in thanks. And Tammy Morgan stirs awake, realizing she’s tied up.

dialogues.speaker: TAMMY
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: AHHH
dialogues.text: Tammy scrunches her eyes closed, praying for the nightmar end. IT NEVER WILL.
